org.jppf.client.utils

Class ClientWithFailover

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jppf.client.utils.ClientWithFailover
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EventListener, ClientConnectionStatusListener, ClientListener

    public class ClientWithFailover
extends Object
implements ClientListener, ClientConnectionStatusListener
    A wrapper for a JPPF client which provides connections failover based on their priority.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected JPPFClient client
      The JPPF client to which requests are delegated.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ClientWithFailover(ClientListener... listeners)
      Initialize this client wrapper with the specified array of listeners.
      ClientWithFailover(String uuid, ClientListener... listeners)
      Initialize this client wrapper with the specified uuid and array of listeners.

    • Field Detail

      • client

        protected final JPPFClient client
        The JPPF client to which requests are delegated.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ClientWithFailover

        public ClientWithFailover(ClientListener... listeners)
        Initialize this client wrapper with the specified array of listeners.
        Parameters:
        listeners - an array of ClientListeners to add to the client upon startup. This array may be empty, in which case it is equivalent to invoking a no-args constructor.

      • ClientWithFailover

        public ClientWithFailover(String uuid,
                  ClientListener... listeners)
        Initialize this client wrapper with the specified uuid and array of listeners.
        Parameters:
        uuid - a user-defined uuid assigned to the JPPF client.
        listeners - an array of ClientListeners to add to the client upon startup. This array may be empty, in which case it is equivalent to invoking constructor with the uuid as its sole argument.

    • Method Detail

public List<JPPFTask> submit(JPPFJob job)
                      throws Exception
        Deprecated. use ClientWithFailover.submitJob(JPPFJob) instead.
        Submit the specified job.
        Parameters:
        job - the job to submit.
        Returns:
        a list of jppf tasks or null if the job is non-blocking.
        Throws:
        Exception - if any error occurs.*

                        throws Exception
        Submit the specified job.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • cancelJob

        public boolean cancelJob(String uuid)
                  throws Exception
        Cancel the job with the specified uuid.
        Parameters:
        uuid - the uuid of the job to cancel.
        Returns:
        true if the cancel succeeded, false if it failed or if a cacel has already been requested for the job.
        Throws:
        Exception - if any error occurs.
